intro: Phaeoneuron gracile, commonly known as the slender phaeoneuron, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Its roots are fibrous and contribute to the soil's organic matter. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Phaeoneuron gracile is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
